properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of the disk. Provide this property when you create a resource.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of the disk. Provide this property when you create a resource.

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Optional) The ID of the folder that the disk belongs to. If it is not provided, the default provider folder is used.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) Labels to assign to this disk. A list of key/value pairs.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: • zone - (Optional) Availability zone where the disk will reside.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Optional) Size of the persistent disk, specified in GB. You can specify this field when creating a persistent disk using the image_id or snapshot_id parameter, or specify it alone to create an empty persistent disk. If you specify this field along with image_id or snapshot_id, the size value must not be less than the size of the source image or the size of the snapshot.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) Type of disk to create. Provide this when creating a disk. One of network-hdd (default) or network-nvme.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Optional) The source image to use for disk creation.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: • snapshot_id - (Optional) The source snapshot to use for disk creation.
NOTE: Only one of image_id or snapshot_id can be specified.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of the disk.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) An optional description of the image. Provide this property when you create a resource.

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Optional) The ID of the folder that the resource belongs to. If it is not provided, the default provider folder is used.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) A set of key/value label pairs to assign to the image.

properties.name: family
properties.description: • family - (Optional) The name of the image family to which this image belongs.

properties.name: min_disk_size
properties.description: • min_disk_size - (Optional) Minimum size in GB of the disk that will be created from this image.

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: • os_type - (Optional) Operating system type that is contained in the image. Possible values: "LINUX", "WINDOWS".

properties.name: source_family
properties.description: • source_family - (Optional) The name of the family to use as the source of the new image. The ID of the latest image is taken from the "standard-images" folder. Changing the family forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: source_image
properties.description: • source_image - (Optional) The ID of an existing image to use as the source of the image. Changing this ID forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: source_snapshot
properties.description: • source_snapshot - (Optional) The ID of a snapshot to use as the source of the image. Changing this ID forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: source_disk
properties.description: • source_disk - (Optional) The ID of a disk to use as the source of the image. Changing this ID forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: source_url
properties.description: • source_url - (Optional) The URL to use as the source of the image. Changing this URL forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: product_ids
properties.description: • product_ids - (Optional) License IDs that indicate which licenses are attached to this image.
NOTE: One of source_family, source_image, source_snapshot, source_disk or source_url must be specified.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: resources
properties.description: • resources - (Required) Compute resources that are allocated for the instance. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: boot_disk
properties.description: • boot_disk - (Required) The boot disk for the instance. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: network_interface
properties.description: • network_interface - (Required) Networks to attach to the instance. This can be specified multiple times. The structure is documented below.
<hr/>

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Resource name.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of the instance.

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Optional) The ID of the folder that the resource belongs to. If it is not provided, the default provider folder is used.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) A set of key/value label pairs to assign to the instance.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: • zone - (Optional) The availability zone where the virtual machine will be created. If it is not provided, the default provider folder is used.

properties.name: hostname
properties.description: • hostname - (Optional) Host name for the instance. This field is used to generate the instance fqdn value. The host name must be unique within the network and region. If not specified, the host name will be equal to id of the instance and fqdn will be <id>.auto.internal. Otherwise FQDN will be <hostname>.<region_id>.internal.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from within the instance.

properties.name: platform_id
properties.description: • platform_id - (Optional) The type of virtual machine to create. The default is 'standard-v1'.

properties.name: secondary_disk
properties.description: • secondary_disk - (Optional) A list of disks to attach to the instance. The structure is documented below. Note: The allow_stopping_for_update property must be set to true in order to update this structure.

properties.name: scheduling_policy
properties.description: • scheduling_policy - (Optional) Scheduling policy configuration. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: service_account_id
properties.description: • service_account_id - (Optional) ID of the service account authorized for this instance.

properties.name: allow_stopping_for_update
properties.description: • allow_stopping_for_update - (Optional) If true, allows Terraform to stop the instance in order to update its properties. If you try to update a property that requires stopping the instance without setting this field, the update will fail.
<hr/>
The resources block supports:

properties.name: cores
properties.description: • cores - (Required) CPU cores for the instance.

properties.name: memory
properties.description: • memory - (Required) Memory size in GB.

properties.name: core_fraction
properties.description: • core_fraction - (Optional) If provided, specifies baseline performance for a core as a percent.
The boot_disk block supports:

properties.name: auto_delete
properties.description: • auto_delete - (Optional) Defines whether the disk will be auto-deleted when the instance is deleted. The default value is True.

properties.name: device_name
properties.description: • device_name - (Optional) Name that can be used to access an attached disk.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: • mode - (Optional) Type of access to the disk resource. By default, a disk is attached in READ_WRITE mode.

properties.name: disk_id
properties.description: • disk_id - (Optional) The ID of the existing disk (such as those managed by yandex_compute_disk) to attach as a boot disk.

properties.name: initialize_params
properties.description: • initialize_params - (Optional) Parameters for a new disk that will be created alongside the new instance. Either initialize_params or disk_id must be set. The structure is documented below.
NOTE: Either initialize_params or disk_id must be specified.
The initialize_params block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of the boot disk.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of the boot disk.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Optional) Size of the disk in GB.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) Disk type.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Optional) A disk image to initialize this disk from.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: • snapshot_id - (Optional) A snapshot to initialize this disk from.
NOTE: Either image_id or snapshot_id must be specified.
The network_interface block supports:

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) ID of the subnet to attach this interface to. The subnet must exist in the same zone where this instance will be created.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Optional) The private IP address to assign to the instance. If empty, the address will be automatically assigned from the specified subnet.

properties.name: ipv6
properties.description: • ipv6 - (Optional) If true, allocate an IPv6 address for the interface. The address will be automatically assigned from the specified subnet.

properties.name: ipv6_address
properties.description: • ipv6_address - (Optional) The private IPv6 address to assign to the instance.

properties.name: nat
properties.description: • nat - (Optional) Provide a public address, for instance, to access the internet over NAT.
The secondary_disk block supports:

properties.name: disk_id
properties.description: • disk_id - (Required) ID of the disk that is attached to the instance.

properties.name: auto_delete
properties.description: • auto_delete - (Optional) Whether the disk is auto-deleted when the instance is deleted. The default value is false.

properties.name: device_name
properties.description: • device_name - (Optional) Name that can be used to access an attached disk under /dev/disk/by-id/.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: • mode - (Optional) Type of access to the disk resource. By default, a disk is attached in READ_WRITE mode.
The scheduling_policy block supports:

properties.name: preemptible
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies if the instance is preemptible. Defaults to false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Required) The ID of the folder that the resources belong to.

properties.name: scale_policy
properties.description: • scale_policy - (Required) The scaling policy of the instance group. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: deploy_policy
properties.description: • deploy_policy - (Required) The deployment policy of the instance group. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: service_account_id
properties.description: • service_account_id - (Required) The ID of the service account authorized for this instance group.

properties.name: instance_template
properties.description: • instance_template - (Required) The template for creating new instances. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: allocation_policy
properties.description: • allocation_policy - (Required) The allocation policy of the instance group by zone and region. The structure is documented below.
<hr/>

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the instance group.

properties.name: health_check
properties.description: • health_check - (Optional) Health check specifications. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: load_balancer
properties.description: • load_balancer - (Optional) Load balancing specifications. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the instance group.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) A set of key/value label pairs to assign to the instance group.
<hr/>
The load_balancer block supports:

properties.name: target_group_name
properties.description: • target_group_name - (Optional) The name of the target group.

properties.name: target_group_description
properties.description: • target_group_description - (Optional) A description of the target group.

properties.name: target_group_labels
properties.description: • target_group_labels - (Optional) A set of key/value label pairs.
<hr/>
The health_check block supports:

properties.name: interval
properties.description: • interval - (Optional) The interval to wait between health checks in seconds.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: • timeout - (Optional) The length of time to wait for a response before the health check times out in seconds.

properties.name: healthy_threshold
properties.description: • healthy_threshold - (Optional) The number of successful health checks before the managed instance is declared healthy.

properties.name: unhealthy_threshold
properties.description: • unhealthy_threshold - (Optional) The number of failed health checks before the managed instance is declared unhealthy.

properties.name: tcp_options
properties.description: • tcp_options - (Optional) TCP check options. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: http_options
properties.description: • http_options - (Optional) HTTP check options. The structure is documented below.
<hr/>
The http_options block supports:

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required) The port used for HTTP health checks.

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) The URL path used for health check requests.
<hr/>
The tcp_options block supports:

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required) The port used for TCP health checks.
<hr/>
The allocation_policy block supports:

properties.name: zones
properties.description: (Required) A list of availability zones.
<hr/>
The instance_template block supports:

properties.name: boot_disk
properties.description: • boot_disk - (Required) Boot disk specifications for the instance. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: resources
properties.description: • resources - (Required) Compute resource specifications for the instance. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: network_interface
properties.description: • network_interface - (Required) Network specifications for the instance. This can be used multiple times for adding multiple interfaces. The structure is documented below.
<hr/>

properties.name: scheduling_policy
properties.description: • scheduling_policy - (Optional) The scheduling policy configuration. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the instance.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) A set of metadata key/value pairs to make available from within the instance.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) A set of key/value label pairs to assign to the instance.

properties.name: platform_id
properties.description: • platform_id - (Optional) The ID of the hardware platform configuration for the instance. The default is 'standard-v1'.

properties.name: secondary_disk
properties.description: • secondary_disk - (Optional) A list of disks to attach to the instance. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: service_account_id
properties.description: • service_account_id - (Optional) The ID of the service account authorized for this instance.
<hr/>
The secondary_disk block supports:

properties.name: mode
properties.description: • mode - (Required) The access mode to the disk resource. By default a disk is attached in READ_WRITE mode.

properties.name: initialize_params
properties.description: • initialize_params - (Required) Parameters used for creating a disk alongside the instance. The structure is documented below.
<hr/>

properties.name: device_name
properties.description: (Optional) This value can be used to reference the device under /dev/disk/by-id/.
<hr/>
The initialize_params block supports:

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the boot disk.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Optional) The size of the disk in GB.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) The disk type.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Optional) The disk image to initialize this disk from.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: • snapshot_id - (Optional) The snapshot to initialize this disk from.
NOTE: image_id or snapshot_id must be specified.
<hr/>
The scheduling_policy block supports:

properties.name: preemptible
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies if the instance is preemptible. Defaults to false.
<hr/>
The network_interface block supports:

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Optional) The ID of the network.

properties.name: subnet_ids
properties.description: • subnet_ids - (Optional) The ID of the subnets to attach this interface to.

properties.name: nat
properties.description: • nat - (Optional) A public address that can be used to access the internet over NAT.
<hr/>
The resources block supports:

properties.name: memory
properties.description: • memory - (Required) The memory size in GB.

properties.name: cores
properties.description: • cores - (Required) The number of CPU cores for the instance.
<hr/>

properties.name: core_fraction
properties.description: (Optional) If provided, specifies baseline core performance as a percent.
<hr/>
The boot_disk block supports:

properties.name: mode
properties.description: • mode - (Required) The access mode to the disk resource. By default a disk is attached in READ_WRITE mode.

properties.name: initialize_params
properties.description: • initialize_params - (Required) Parameters for creating a disk alongside the instance. The structure is documented below.
<hr/>

properties.name: device_name
properties.description: (Optional) This value can be used to reference the device under /dev/disk/by-id/.
<hr/>
The initialize_params block supports:

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the boot disk.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Optional) The size of the disk in GB.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) The disk type.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Optional) The disk image to initialize this disk from.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: • snapshot_id - (Optional) The snapshot to initialize this disk from.
NOTE: image_id or snapshot_id must be specified.
<hr/>
The deploy_policy block supports:

properties.name: max_unavailable
properties.description: • max_unavailable - (Required) The maximum number of running instances that can be taken offline (stopped or deleted) at the same time during the update process.

properties.name: max_expansion
properties.description: • max_expansion - (Required) The maximum number of instances that can be temporarily allocated above the group's target size during the update process.
<hr/>

properties.name: max_deleting
properties.description: • max_deleting - (Optional) The maximum number of instances that can be deleted at the same time.

properties.name: max_creating
properties.description: • max_creating - (Optional) The maximum number of instances that can be created at the same time.

properties.name: startup_duration
properties.description: • startup_duration - (Optional) The amount of time in seconds to allow for an instance to start. Instance will be considered up and running (and start receiving traffic) only after the startup_duration has elapsed and all health checks are passed.
<hr/>
The scale_policy block supports:

properties.name: fixed_scale
properties.description: • fixed_scale - (Optional) The fixed scaling policy of the instance group. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: auto_scale
properties.description: • auto_scale - (Optional) The auto scaling policy of the instance group. The structure is documented below.
NOTE: Either fixed_scale or auto_scale must be specified.
<hr/>
The fixed_scale block supports:

properties.name: size
properties.description: (Required) The number of instances in the instance group.
<hr/>
The auto_scale block supports:

properties.name: initial_size
properties.description: • initial_size - (Required) The initial number of instances in the instance group.

properties.name: measurement_duration
properties.description: • measurement_duration - (Required) The amount of time, in seconds, that metrics are averaged for. If the average value at the end of the interval is higher than the cpu_utilization_target, the instance group will increase the number of virtual machines in the group.

properties.name: cpu_utilization_target
properties.description: • cpu_utilization_target - (Required) Target CPU load level.

properties.name: min_zone_size
properties.description: • min_zone_size - (Optional) The minimum number of virtual machines in a single availability zone.

properties.name: max_size
properties.description: • max_size - (Optional) The maximum number of virtual machines in the group.

properties.name: warmup_duration
properties.description: • warmup_duration - (Optional) The warm-up time of the virtual machine, in seconds. During this time, traffic is fed to the virtual machine, but load metrics are not taken into account.

properties.name: stabilization_duration
properties.description: • stabilization_duration - (Optional) The minimum time interval, in seconds, to monitor the load before an instance group can reduce the number of virtual machines in the group. During this time, the group will not decrease even if the average load falls below the value of cpu_utilization_target.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: source_disk_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the disk to create a snapshot from.
<hr/>

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A name for the resource.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of the resource.

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Optional) The ID of the folder that the resource belongs to. If it is not provided, the default provider folder is used.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) A set of key/value label pairs to assign to the snapshot.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Optional) Folder that the resource belongs to. If a value is not provided, the default provider folder is used

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A name of the registry.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) A set of key/value label pairs to assign to the registry.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of the service account. Can be updated without creating a new resource.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of the service account.

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Optional) ID of the folder that the service account will be created in. Defaults to the provider folder configuration.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_account_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the service account to an API key for.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the key.

properties.name: pgp_key
properties.description: • pgp_key - (Optional) An optional PGP key to encrypt the resulting secret key material. May either be a base64-encoded public key or a keybase username in the form keybase:keybaseusername.

type: IAM policy for a service account

properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_account_id
properties.description: • service_account_id - (Required) The service account ID to apply a binding to.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied. Only one yandex_iam_service_account_iam_binding can be used per role.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: members - (Required) Identities that will be granted the privilege in role. Each entry can have one of the following values:
• userAccount:{user_id}: A unique user ID that represents a specific Yandex account.
• serviceAccount:{service_account_id}: A unique service account ID.

type: IAM policy for a service account

properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_account_id
properties.description: • service_account_id - (Required) The service account ID to apply a policy to.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied. Only one yandex_iam_service_account_iam_binding can be used per role.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: member - (Required) Identity that will be granted the privilege in role. Entry can have one of the following values:
• userAccount:{user_id}: A unique user ID that represents a specific Yandex account.
• serviceAccount:{service_account_id}: A unique service account ID.

type: IAM policy for a service account

properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_account_id
properties.description: • service_account_id - (Required) The service account ID to apply a policy to.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: members - (Required) Identities that will be granted the privilege in role. Each entry can have one of the following values:
• userAccount:{user_id}: A unique user ID that represents a specific Yandex account.
• serviceAccount:{service_account_id}: A unique service account ID.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be applied. Only one yandex_iam_service_account_iam_binding can be used per role.

properties.name: policy_data
properties.description: • policy_data - (Required only by yandex_iam_service_account_iam_policy) The policy data generated by a yandex_iam_policy data source.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_account_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the service account to create a pair for.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the key pair.

properties.name: format
properties.description: • format - (Optional) The output format of the keys. PEM_FILE is the default format.

properties.name: key_algorithm
properties.description: • key_algorithm - (Optional) The algorithm used to generate the key. RSA_2048 is the default algorithm. Valid values are listed in the API reference.

properties.name: pgp_key
properties.description: • pgp_key - (Optional) An optional PGP key to encrypt the resulting private key material. May either be a base64-encoded public key or a keybase username in the form keybase:keybaseusername.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_account_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the service account which is used to get a static key.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the service account static key.

properties.name: pgp_key
properties.description: • pgp_key - (Optional) An optional PGP key to encrypt the resulting secret key material. May either be a base64-encoded public key or a keybase username in the form keybase:keybaseusername.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of the network load balancer. Provided by the client when the network load balancer is created.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) An optional description of the network load balancer. Provide this property when you create the resource.

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Optional) The ID of the folder to which the resource belongs. If omitted, the provider folder is used.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) Labels to assign to this network load balancer. A list of key/value pairs.

properties.name: region_id
properties.description: • region_id - (Optional) ID of the availability zone where the network load balancer resides. The default is 'ru-central1'.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) Type of the network load balancer. Only external network load balancers are currently available. The default is 'external'.

properties.name: attached_target_group
properties.description: • attached_target_group - (Optional) An AttachedTargetGroup resource. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: listener
properties.description: • listener - (Optional) Listener specification that will be used by a network load balancer. The structure is documented below.
<hr/>
The attached_target_group block supports:

properties.name: target_group_id
properties.description: • target_group_id - (Required) ID of the target group.

properties.name: healthcheck
properties.description: • healthcheck - (Required) A HealthCheck resource. The structure is documented below.
<hr/>
The healthcheck block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the health check. The name must be unique for each target group that attached to a single load balancer.

properties.name: interval
properties.description: • interval - (Optional) The interval between health checks. The default is 2 seconds.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: • timeout - (Optional) Timeout for a target to return a response for the health check. The default is 1 second.

properties.name: unhealthy_threshold
properties.description: • unhealthy_threshold - (Optional) Number of failed health checks before changing the status to UNHEALTHY. The default is 2.

properties.name: healthy_threshold
properties.description: • healthy_threshold - (Optional) Number of successful health checks required in order to set the HEALTHY status for the target.

properties.name: http_options
properties.description: • http_options - (Optional) Options for HTTP health check. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: tcp_options
properties.description: • tcp_options - (Optional) Options for TCP health check. The structure is documented below.
NOTE: One of http_options or tcp_options should be specified.
<hr/>
The http_options block supports:

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required) Port to use for HTTP health checks.

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Optional) URL path to set for health checking requests for every target in the target group. For example /ping. The default path is /.
<hr/>
The tcp_options block supports:

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required) Port to use for TCP health checks.
<hr/>
The listener block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the listener. The name must be unique for each listener on a single load balancer.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required) Port for incoming traffic.

properties.name: target_port
properties.description: • target_port - (Optional) Port of a target. The default is the same as listener's port.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Optional) Protocol for incoming traffic. Only tcp network load balancers are currently available.

properties.name: external_address_spec
properties.description: • external_address_spec - (Optional) External IP address specification. The structure is documented below.
<hr/>
The external_address_spec block supports:

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Optional) Public IP address for a listener. IP address will be allocated if it wasn't been set.

properties.name: ip_version
properties.description: • ip_version - (Optional) IP version of the addresses that the load balancer works with. Only ipv4 is currently available.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of the target group. Provided by the client when the target group is created.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) An optional description of the target group. Provide this property when you create the resource.

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Optional) The ID of the folder to which the resource belongs. If omitted, the provider folder is used.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) Labels to assign to this target group. A list of key/value pairs.

properties.name: region_id
properties.description: • region_id - (Optional) ID of the availability zone where the target group resides. The default is 'ru-central1'.

properties.name: target
properties.description: • target - (Optional) A Target resource. The structure is documented below.
<hr/>
The target block supports:

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Required) IP address of the target.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) ID of the subnet that targets are connected to. All targets in the target group must be connected to the same subnet within a single availability zone.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the Redis cluster. Provided by the client when the cluster is created.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) ID of the network, to which the Redis cluster belongs.

properties.name: environment
properties.description: • environment - (Required) Deployment environment of the Redis cluster.

properties.name: config
properties.description: • config - (Required) Configuration of the Redis cluster. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: resources
properties.description: • resources - (Required) Resources allocated to hosts of the Redis cluster. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: host
properties.description: • host - (Required) A host of the Redis cluster. The structure is documented below.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of the Redis cluster.

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Optional) The ID of the folder that the resource belongs to. If it is not provided, the default provider folder is used.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) A set of key/value label pairs to assign to the Redis cluster.

properties.name: sharded
properties.description: • sharded - (Optional) Redis Cluster mode enabled/disabled.
<hr/>
The config block supports:

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Required) Password for the Redis cluster.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: • timeout - (Optional) Close the connection after a client is idle for N seconds.

properties.name: maxmemory_policy
properties.description: • maxmemory_policy - (Optional) Redis key eviction policy for a dataset that reaches maximum memory.
The resources block supports:

properties.name: resources_preset_id
properties.description: • resources_preset_id - (Required) The ID of the preset for computational resources available to a host (CPU, memory etc.). For more information, see the official documentation.

properties.name: disk_size
properties.description: • disk_size - (Required) Volume of the storage available to a host, in gigabytes.
The host block supports:

properties.name: fqdn
properties.description: • fqdn (Computed) - The fully qualified domain name of the host.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: • zone - (Required) The availability zone where the Redis host will be created.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id (Optional) - The ID of the subnet, to which the host belongs. The subnet must be a part of the network to which the cluster belongs.

properties.name: shard_name
properties.description: • shard_name (Optional) - The name of the shard to which the host belongs.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Name of a specific Kubernetes cluster.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A description of the Kubernetes cluster.

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Optional) The ID of the folder that the Kubernetes cluster belongs to. If it is not provided, the default provider folder is used.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) A set of key/value label pairs to assign to the Kubernetes cluster.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Optional) The ID of the cluster network.

properties.name: cluster_ipv4_range
properties.description: • cluster_ipv4_range - (Optional) CIDR block. IP range for allocating pod addresses. It should not overlap with any subnet in the network the Kubernetes cluster located in. Static routes will be set up for this CIDR blocks in node subnets.

properties.name: service_ipv4_range
properties.description: • service_ipv4_range - (Optional) CIDR block. IP range Kubernetes service Kubernetes cluster IP addresses will be allocated from. It should not overlap with any subnet in the network the Kubernetes cluster located in.

properties.name: service_account_id
properties.description: • service_account_id - Service account to be used for provisioning Compute Cloud and VPC resources for Kubernetes cluster. Selected service account should have edit role on the folder where the Kubernetes cluster will be located and on the folder where selected network resides.

properties.name: node_service_account_id
properties.description: • node_service_account_id - Service account to be used by the worker nodes of the Kubernetes cluster to access Container Registry or to push node logs and metrics.

properties.name: release_channel
properties.description: • release_channel - Cluster release channel.

properties.name: master
properties.description: • master - IP allocation policy of the Kubernetes cluster.
The structure is documented below.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cluster_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the Kubernetes cluster that this node group belongs to.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Name of a specific Kubernetes node group.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A description of the Kubernetes node group.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: (Optional) A set of key/value label pairs assigned to the Kubernetes node group.

properties.name: version
properties.description: (Optional) Version of Kubernetes that will be used for Kubernetes node group.

properties.name: instance_template
properties.description: (Required) Template used to create compute instances in this Kubernetes node group.
The structure is documented below.

properties.name: scale_policy
properties.description: (Required) Scale policy of the node group.
The structure is documented below.

properties.name: allocation_policy
properties.description: This argument specify subnets (zones), that will be used by node group compute instances.
The structure is documented below.

properties.name: instance_group_id
properties.description: • instance_group_id - (Computed) ID of instance group that is used to manage this Kubernetes node group.

properties.name: maintenance_policy
properties.description: • maintenance_policy - (Computed) Information about maintenance policy for this Kubernetes node group.
The structure is documented below.

properties.name: version_info
properties.description: (Computed) Information about Kubernetes node group version.
The structure is documented below.
<hr/>
The instance_template block supports:

properties.name: platform_id
properties.description: The ID of the hardware platform configuration for the node group compute instances.

properties.name: nat
properties.description: Boolean flag, enables NAT for node group compute instances.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: The set of metadata key:value pairs assigned to this instance template. This includes custom metadata and predefined keys.

properties.name: resources.0.memory
properties.description: The memory size allocated to the instance.

properties.name: resources.0.cores
properties.description: Number of CPU cores allocated to the instance.

properties.name: resources.0.core_fraction
properties.description: • resources.0.core_fraction - Baseline core performance as a percent.

properties.name: boot_disk
properties.description: • boot_disk - The specifications for boot disks that will be attached to the instance.
The structure is documented below.

properties.name: scheduling_policy
properties.description: The scheduling policy for the instances in node group.
The structure is documented below.

properties.name: status
properties.description: (Computed) Status of the Kubernetes node group.

properties.name: created_at
properties.description: (Computed) The Kubernetes node group creation timestamp.
<hr/>
The boot_disk block supports:

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the disk in GB. Allowed minimal size: 64 GB.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The disk type.
<hr/>
The scheduling_policy block supports:

properties.name: preemptible
properties.description: Specifies if the instance is preemptible. Defaults to false.
<hr/>
The scale_policy block supports:

properties.name: fixed_scale
properties.description: The fixed scaling policy of the instance group.
The structure is documented below.
<hr/>
The fixed_scale block supports:

properties.name: size
properties.description: The number of instances in the node group.
<hr/>
The allocation_policy block supports:

properties.name: location
properties.description: Repeated field, that specify subnets (zones), that will be used by node group compute instances.
The structure is documented below.
<hr/>
The location block supports:

properties.name: zone
properties.description: ID of the availability zone where for one compute instance in node group.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: ID of the subnet, that will be used by one compute instance in node group.
Subnet specified by subnet_id should be allocated in zone specified by 'zone' argument
<hr/>
The maintenance_policy block supports:

properties.name: auto_upgrade
properties.description: Boolean flag.

properties.name: auto_repair
properties.description: - Boolean flag.
<hr/>
The version_info block supports:

properties.name: current_version
properties.description: Current Kubernetes version, major.minor (e.g. 1.15).

properties.name: new_revision_available
properties.description: • new_revision_available - True/false flag. Newer revisions may include Kubernetes patches (e.g 1.15.1 -> 1.15.2) as well as some internal component updates - new features or bug fixes in yandex-specific components either on the master or nodes.

properties.name: new_revision_summary
properties.description: • new_revision_summary - Human readable description of the changes to be applied when updating to the latest revision. Empty if new_revision_available is false.

properties.name: version_deprecated
properties.description: • version_deprecated - True/false flag. The current version is on the deprecation schedule, component (master or node group) should be upgraded.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: bucket
properties.description: • bucket - (Optional, Forces new resource) The name of the bucket. If omitted, Terraform will assign a random, unique name.

properties.name: bucket_prefix
properties.description: • bucket_prefix - (Optional, Forces new resource) Creates a unique bucket name beginning with the specified prefix. Conflicts with bucket.

properties.name: access_key
properties.description: • access_key - (Optional) The access key to use when applying changes. If omitted, storage_access_key specified in config is used.

properties.name: secret_key
properties.description: • secret_key - (Optional) The secret key to use when applying changes. If omitted, storage_secret_key specified in config is used.

properties.name: acl
properties.description: • acl - (Optional) The predefined ACL to apply. Defaults to private.

Note: To change ACL after creation, the service account to which used access and secret keys correspond should have admin role, though this role is not necessary to be able to create a bucket with any ACL.

properties.name: force_destroy
properties.description: • force_destroy - (Optional, Default: false) A boolean that indicates all objects should be deleted from the bucket so that the bucket can be destroyed without error. These objects are not recoverable.

properties.name: website
properties.description: • website - (Optional) A website object (documented below).

properties.name: cors_rule
properties.description: • cors_rule - (Optional) A rule of Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (documented below).
The website object supports the following:

properties.name: index_document
properties.description: • index_document - (Required) Storage returns this index document when requests are made to the root domain or any of the subfolders.

properties.name: error_document
properties.description: • error_document - (Optional) An absolute path to the document to return in case of a 4XX error.
The CORS object supports the following:

properties.name: allowed_headers
properties.description: • allowed_headers (Optional) Specifies which headers are allowed.

properties.name: allowed_methods
properties.description: • allowed_methods (Required) Specifies which methods are allowed. Can be GET, PUT, POST, DELETE or HEAD.

properties.name: allowed_origins
properties.description: • allowed_origins (Required) Specifies which origins are allowed.

properties.name: expose_headers
properties.description: • expose_headers (Optional) Specifies expose header in the response.

properties.name: max_age_seconds
properties.description: • max_age_seconds (Optional) Specifies time in seconds that browser can cache the response for a preflight request.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: bucket
properties.description: • bucket - (Required) The name of the containing bucket.

properties.name: key
properties.description: • key - (Required) The name of the object once it is in the bucket.

properties.name: source
properties.description: • source - (Optional, conflicts with content and content_base64) The path to a file that will be read and uploaded as raw bytes for the object content.

properties.name: content
properties.description: • content - (Optional, conflicts with source and content_base64) Literal string value to use as the object content, which will be uploaded as UTF-8-encoded text.

properties.name: content_base64
properties.description: • content_base64 - (Optional, conflicts with source and content) Base64-encoded data that will be decoded and uploaded as raw bytes for the object content. This allows safely uploading non-UTF8 binary data, but is recommended only for small content such as the result of the gzipbase64 function with small text strings. For larger objects, use source to stream the content from a disk file.

properties.name: access_key
properties.description: • access_key - (Optional) The access key to use when applying changes. If omitted, storage_access_key specified in config is used.

properties.name: secret_key
properties.description: • secret_key - (Optional) The secret key to use when applying changes. If omitted, storage_secret_key specified in config is used.

properties.name: acl
properties.description: • acl - (Optional) The predefined ACL to apply. Defaults to private.

Note: To change ACL after creation, the service account to which used access and secret keys correspond should have admin role, though this role is not necessary to be able to create an object with any ACL.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_id
properties.description: • cloud_id - (Required) ID of the cloud to attach the policy to.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be assigned. Only one yandex_resourcemanager_cloud_iam_binding can be used per role.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: members - (Required) An array of identities that will be granted the privilege in the role. Each entry can have one of the following values:
• userAccount:{user_id}: A unique user ID that represents a specific Yandex account.
• serviceAccount:{service_account_id}: A unique service account ID.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_id
properties.description: • cloud_id - (Required) ID of the cloud to attach a policy to.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be assigned.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: member - (Required) The identity that will be granted the privilege that is specified in the role field. This field can have one of the following values:
• userAccount:{user_id}: A unique user ID that represents a specific Yandex account.
• serviceAccount:{service_account_id}: A unique service account ID.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Required) ID of the folder to attach a policy to.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be assigned. Only one yandex_resourcemanager_folder_iam_binding can be used per role.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: members - (Required) An array of identities that will be granted the privilege that is specified in the role field. Each entry can have one of the following values:
• userAccount:{user_id}: An email address that represents a specific Yandex account. For example, ivan@yandex.ru or joe@example.com.
• serviceAccount:{service_account_id}: A unique service account ID.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Required) ID of the folder to attach a policy to.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The role that should be assigned.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: member - (Required) The identity that will be granted the privilege that is specified in the role field. This field can have one of the following values:
• userAccount:{user_id}: A unique user ID that represents a specific Yandex account.
• serviceAccount:{service_account_id}: A unique service account ID.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Required) ID of the folder that the policy is attached to.

properties.name: policy_data
properties.description: • policy_data - (Required) The yandex_iam_policy data source that represents the IAM policy that will be applied to the folder. This policy overrides any existing policy applied to the folder.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of the network. Provided by the client when the network is created.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) An optional description of this resource. Provide this property when you create the resource.

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Optional) ID of the folder that the resource belongs to. If it is not provided, the default provider folder is used.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) Labels to apply to this network. A list of key/value pairs.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the network this route table belongs to.
<hr/>

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of the route table. Provided by the client when the route table is created.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) An optional description of the route table. Provide this property when you create the resource.

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Optional) The ID of the folder to which the resource belongs. If omitted, the provider folder is used.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) Labels to assign to this route table. A list of key/value pairs.

properties.name: static_route
properties.description: • static_route - (Optional) A list of static route records for the route table. The structure is documented below.
The static_route block supports:

properties.name: destination_prefix
properties.description: • destination_prefix - Route prefix in CIDR notation.

properties.name: next_hop_address
properties.description: • next_hop_address - Address of the next hop.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) ID of the network this subnet belongs to. Only networks that are in the distributed mode can have subnets.

properties.name: v4_cidr_blocks
properties.description: • v4_cidr_blocks - (Required) A list of blocks of internal IPv4 addresses that are owned by this subnet. Provide this property when you create the subnet. For example, 10.0.0.0/22 or 192.168.0.0/16. Blocks of addresses must be unique and non-overlapping within a network. Minimum subnet size is /28, and maximum subnet size is /16. Only IPv4 is supported.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: • zone - (Required) Name of the Yandex.Cloud zone for this subnet.
<hr/>

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of the subnet. Provided by the client when the subnet is created.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) An optional description of the subnet. Provide this property when you create the resource.

properties.name: folder_id
properties.description: • folder_id - (Optional) The ID of the folder to which the resource belongs. If omitted, the provider folder is used.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) Labels to assign to this subnet. A list of key/value pairs.

properties.name: route_table_id
properties.description: • route_table_id - (Optional) The ID of the route table to assign to this subnet. Assigned route table should belong to the same network as this subnet.
